title: proposal: introduce OWNERS file
body:
In #12361, brad mentions that he didn't know the owner of
compress/gzip, I think this might be a problem worth fixing in
a more systematic way.

A lot of open source software has a mechanism that
document the owners (and potential reviewers) for each
component. For example, Chrome uses the OWNERS file to
record such information.

Should we adopt a similar scheme?

Advantages:
1. people contributing patches know exactly who to add as reviewer.
2. gopherbot can automatically add /cc to a triaged issue. (see also
https://golang.org/cl/13475 for background.)

Disadvantages:
we need to populate the OWNERS file and decide whether it
lives in each package directory or there is a global file. We also
have to keep the file up-to-date.

We can use git log to populate the OWNERS file with the two
or three most frequent (or edited the most lines) authors for
each package, and then manually edit as necessary.
